segments.source_content:
---
slug: /157
title: "This Week In React #157: Concurrent Mode, RSC DevTools Extension, Gatsby, Radix asChild, Suspense, hydration, useMemo, React-Redux, Fresh, TinyBase, Worklets, TFLite, local_modules, Bootsplash..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 08-22-2023
---
It's been pretty quiet on the React front this week, but we've still got a few nice articles to read.
On the React-Native side, Marc Rousavy is on fire, publishing a number of packages that seem to herald the imminent arrival of VisionCamera v3.

We should have some nice releases soon, like [ğŸ¦ Bun 1.0](https://twitter.com/jarredsumner/status/1693657906917585359), [ğŸ¦ Astro 3.0](https://twitter.com/astrodotbuild/status/1693655809711108456) and [ğŸ¦ TanStack Router](https://twitter.com/tannerlinsley/status/1691936709498552654).
I'm taking a short break next week, so I'll see you on 6 September ğŸ‘‹
**ğŸ’¡ [Check this newsletter on Twitter](https://slo.im/thread) - visual format ğŸ¨**

Managing or migrating large apps and codebases? This video course covers what you need to know to scale efficiently whilst maintaining code quality. Covers unit testing, CI pipelines, mocking, code coverage, and more.

A quite technical but greatly educational article that study the React codebase. Explains well how `startTransition` works and how it differs from the synchronous rendering mode. I learned how React uses the `MessageChannel` API recursively to periodically hand over to the main thread.

* ğŸ’¸ [Zero To Shipped - Master Fast-Paced Fullstack Development and **Finally** ship that product](https://www.zerotoshipped.com/)
* ğŸ¦ [Is Gatsby Dead?](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1694392101281190224): not officially, but its future does not look super promising.
* ğŸ® [React Jam - Summer 2023 Winners](https://reactjam.com/summer-2023-winners): the React-based video games creation challenge for which I was a member of the jury, just announced the winners.
* ğŸ“œ [Implement Radix's asChild pattern in React](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/react-as-child): explains how the `asChild` pattern, popularised by Radix, works as a good alternative to the `as` props for customising the underlying component.
* ğŸ“œ [A11y-Driven Development](https://www.simplethread.com/a11y-driven-development/): interesting proposal to split and name React components according to their accessibility role.
* ğŸ“œ [React Suspense in three different architectures](https://elanmed.dev/blog/suspense-in-different-architectures): presents 4 different `<Suspense>` use cases for 3 different architectures (CSR, SSR, RSC).
* ğŸ“œ [How to solve hydration error in Next.js](https://chirag-gupta.hashnode.dev/how-to-solve-hydration-error-in-nextjs): highlights some common problems that can lead to hydration problems, such as using browser APIs like `localStorage` to initialise your state, or using an invalid HTML markup.
* ğŸ“œ [Using PostHog with the Next.js App Router and Vercel](https://vercel.com/guides/posthog-nextjs-vercel-feature-flags-analytics)
* ğŸ“œ [useMemo overdose](https://edvins.io/usememo-overdose)
* ğŸ“¦ [RSC Devtools - Chrome Extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/rsc-devtools/jcejahepddjnppkhomnidalpnnnemomn): the unofficial extension is now available in the Chrome store. It lets you navigate and analyse a timeline of RSC payloads over time. Read the article [Devtools for React Server Components](https://www.alvar.dev/blog/creating-devtools-for-react-server-components) for details.
* ğŸ“¦ [Fresh 1.4 â€“ Faster Page Loads, Layouts and More](https://deno.com/blog/fresh-1.4)
* ğŸ“¦ [TinyBase 4.1 - New ui-react-dom module](https://tinybase.org/guides/releases/)
* ğŸ“¦ [NextUI 2.1 - Select, Listbox, ScrollShadow](https://nextui.org/blog/v2.1.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [React-Redux 9.0 alpha](https://github.com/reduxjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v9.0.0-alpha.0)
* ğŸ¥ [tRPC + NextJS App Router = Simple Typesafe APIs](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qCLV0Iaq9zU)
* ğŸ¥ [Remotion Lambda - Tutorial Playlist](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLRHdymbhXiIRgAeAUpMxe7l7BNliHfWUq)
* ğŸ¥ [React Query is Secretly an Amazing State Manager](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0X3TlVklT-A)
